content: I’ve been in the TV news business for 35 yrs. and I’ve worked for every cable news channel in that time period. Fake tabloid ‘news’ shows like Inside Edition, Current Affair, and Hard Copy back in the ‘80s-early ’90s essentially ruined the TV news biz. News became a ‘product’ for profit, not an outlet to inform the public responsibly. Now the biz is so fractured that the average viewer just watches the channel that reinforces their world view. And yes, Fox News has essentially ‘made up’ news and stories to appeal to their audience for years. And before anyone starts screaming, I am decidedly apolitical — I think all politicians on BOTH sides are crooks. There is a memo every day when you get into Fox that you read-it tells you WHAT stories to cover- AND WHAT YOU MUST SAY about said story. Last time I checked, covering news was about uncovering facts and reporting them-NOT cherry-picking stories or issues and putting forth an editorial agenda about how to cover them. There are marching orders daily at Fox about what goes on the channel. MSNBC is decidedly liberal, but there was no daily mandate ordering the employees how to cover the news-neither at CNN. The internet makes it impossible now to get ANY news straight up-there is NO vetting-people just click on stories and assume they are true-that’s how Fox News became successful-their audience assumed since it was on the TV Box that what was being broadcast was TRUE. Truth is, people are lazy news consumers, and won’t take the effort to research and find out if the story is factual, and that’s not gonna change. It’s best to assume that ALL the stories are fake-just turn off the TV and read a book.
